entries.title: 'One of my favorite people': What Queen Elizabeth meant to decades of American presidents
entries.description: When Princess Elizabeth landed at Washington National Airport on the last day of October 1951, she emerged from her airplane in a raspberry red coat, a new velvet-brimmed hat and, some people observed, more makeup than usual.

entries.title: 'We need to act right now': Fed Chairman vows to continue aggressive inflation fight
entries.description: At a think tank conference Thursday, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell reiterated his pledge to stay the course on the central bank's aggressive inflation-busting policy.

entries.title: No firearm found at scene of rare fatal police shooting in England, watchdog says
entries.description: No firearm was found at the scene where a Black man was shot dead by police in south London this week, according to a watchdog office investigating the rare fatal police shooting in England.

entries.title: Weekly jobless claims fall again, underscoring tight job market
entries.description: Despite fears of a recession, the labor market is showing no signs of weakening. The number of first-time claims for unemployment benefits fell by 6,000 to 222,000 for the week ended September 3, according to Department of Labor data released Thursday.

entries.title: Opinion: We could see slow economic growth for the rest of the decade
entries.description: So far this year, the US economy has managed to skirt a recession, despite what many experts predicted. But even while the labor market remains strong, there isn't much to celebrate in the foreseeable future. We could still very well find ourselves in a recession over the next 12 months, with limited economic growth and lower prospects for improvement in Americans' standard of living that could linger for the rest of the decade.

entries.title: Price of war: UK and EU throw $500 billion at energy subsidies
entries.description: The United Kingdom on Thursday confirmed plans to subsidize energy bills for households and businesses, joining other European governments in a costly race to protect their economies from freezing up this winter as Russia cuts off supplies of gas.

entries.title: At least 16 dead as heavy rains trigger landslides in Uganda
entries.description: At least 16 people died in western Uganda after heavy rains in the Kasese district on Tuesday night caused a landslide early Wednesday, according to tweets from the Uganda Red Cross.

entries.title: North Korea hopes to build 'socialist fairyland' with new laws
entries.description: North Korea's rubber-stamp parliament convened this week to pass legislation aimed at turning the country into a "beautiful and civilized socialist fairyland," state media reported Thursday.

entries.title: Analysis: Why celebrities are so interested in the unglamorous world of private equity
entries.description: Kim Kardashian. You know her because she's a reality TV and social media star, an entrepreneur, and a budding lawyer. She's a whole brand. And an increasingly powerful force in business.
